decision_details: - International Competitive Bids have been invited for the supply of 3,000 sets of TKR Implant Component for the Total Knee Replacement (TKR) System of Higher Flexion Knee Type per patient basis, which is used to improve mobility by replacing a severely damaged or degenerative knee joint. Only one bid has been submitted for the same. After discussion regarding the rates submitted, M/s Zodiac Medicals (Pvt) Ltd. the local agent of the bidder M/s Zimmer Pte Ltd (Manufacturer: Zimmer Inc., USA), has agreed to provide a 2% discount on the bid price. The Standing High-Level Procurement Committee has recommended to award the procurement for the supply of only 1,000 TKR Component sets for urgent necessities, instead of 3,000 TKR Component sets, to M/s Zimmer Pte Ltd (Manufacturer: Zimmer Inc., USA) in Singapore, and to re-invite bids from the suppliers registered with the National Medicine Regulatory Authority following the Limited International Competitive Bidding procedure for securing the remaining quantity. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Health and Mass Media to implement the said recommendation, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Procurement for the supply of 30,000 vials of 50 mg Liposomal form of Amphotericin B
decision_details: - International competitive bids have been invited for the purchase of 30,000 vials of 50 mg liposomal form of amphotericin B, which is used to treat life‑threatening fungal infections, including cryptococcal meningitis and visceral leishmaniasis, particularly in individuals with compromised immune systems. Three bids have been received for the purpose. Based on the recommendation of the Standing High-Level Procurement Committee, the proposal made by the Minister of Health and Mass Media to award the relevant procurement, to M/s. Slim Pharmaceuticals (Pvt) Ltd., Sri Lanka, (Manufacturer - M/s. Gufic Bioscience Ltd., India), the substantially responsive lowest evaluated bidder, for a total cost of LKR 194.26 million, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Review the functioning of Sri Lanka Institute of Nanotechnology Private Limited (SLINTEC) and Sri Lanka Institute of Biotechnology Private Limited (SLIBTEC)
decision_details: - Sri Lanka Institute of Nanotechnology Private Limited has been established for research and technology transfer based on nanotechnology. Similarly, Sri Lanka Institute of Biotechnology Private Limited has been established with the primary objective of promoting biotechnology exports and creating import substitution products through biotechnology-related research. Under the current domestic and global economic and political trends, it has been identified as appropriate to restructure the two institutions, so that they can contribute more to the rapid economic growth of Sri Lanka through a nanotechnology and biotechnology research and development approach. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Science and Technology to appoint an Expert Committee to review the functioning of Sri Lanka Institute of Nanotechnology Private Limited and Sri Lanka Institute of Biotechnology Private Limited and submit a Report with recommendations regarding the reforms to be made to their legal structure and strategic plans, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Establishment of the Office of Public Prosecutor
decision_details: - It has been proposed through the election manifesto of the present Government to introduce an Office of the Public Prosecutor as a mechanism to prevent delays within the judicial system and establish an independent Office of the Public Prosecutor and Provincial Sub Offices, operating separately from the Attorney General's Department to conduct cases on behalf of the Government. It is expected to improve the independence and transparency of the criminal justice system and expedite the criminal justice process, enabling to gain confidence of the people. The United Nations High Commissioner for Human Rights, in her final report on Sri Lanka submitted in September 2024, has also proposed establishing an independent prosecutional authority as a matter of urgency. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Justice and National Integration to appoint a Committee of Technical Experts chaired by Justice Yasantha Kodagoda, President's Counsel, Judge of the Supreme Court, to examine and report on introducing new legislation for the establishment of such an office, and to make recommendations to introduce necessary amendments to the laws currently in force, where found necessary, was approved by the Cabinet.

decision_details:

title: Public Commercial Business Management Bill
decision_details:
- It has been recognized that state-owned enterprises should be restructured and maintained with good governance with the support of local or foreign investments, without being a continuous burden on the General Treasury and the country's economy.  It is the policy of the new Government to introduce an efficient and transparent mechanism for this purpose. A initial draft titled "Public Commercial Business Management Bill" to introduce a new legal framework required to operate state-owned enterprises with effective management and necessary reforms,  has been prepared by now. This will enable state-owned enterprises to be completely free from political influence and to appoint professionally qualified individuals with expertise in the relevant field with professional qualifications to their Board of Directors. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Hon. President in his capacity as the Minister of Finance, Planning and Economic Development to grant the policy approval of the Cabinet to the said Initial Bill and to appoint a Special Committee with the following composition to submit suitable proposals for further development of the said Initial Bill having reviewed the same, was approved by the Cabinet:

    • Hon. (Dr.) Anil Jayantha Fernando, 
      Minister of Labour and the Deputy Minister of Economic Development - (Chairman)
      
    • Hon. Sunil Handunneththi, 
Minister of Industry and Entrepreneurship Development

    • Hon. Wasantha Samarasinghe, 
Minister of Trade, Commerce, Food Security and Cooperative 			Development

    • Hon. (Dr.) Harshana Sooriyapperuma, 
     Deputy Minister of Finance and Planning

title: Signing of a Memorandum of Understanding for Agricultural Cooperation between the Department of Agriculture of Sri Lanka and the Viet Nam Academy of 	Agricultural Sciences
decision_details: - A Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) has been signed between Sri Lanka and Viet Nam in 2006 with the aim of agricultural cooperation. Accordingly, action plans for the years 2010-2011, 2017-2019, 2022-2024 and 2024-2026 have been signed and implemented with the agreement of both parties. As one of the components of the 2024-2026 Action Plan, there is a potential to work towards enhancing cooperation between institutions of the two countries. Accordingly, it has been proposed to sign a Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) between the Department of Agriculture of Sri Lanka and the Viet Nam Academy of Agricultural Sciences. The concurrence of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs, Foreign Employment and Tourism has been received for the proposed draft MoU. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Agriculture, Livestock, Lands and Irrigation to sign the said Memorandum of Understanding, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Procurement of 152 MW electricity from Ground-mounted Solar PV Plants under International Competitive Bidding
decision_details: - In line with the Long Term Generation Expansion Plan 2023-2042, the Government’s policy is to meet 70% of the energy requirement from renewable energy by 2030. Accordingly, taking into account the decrease in anticipated electricity demand and the recent rapid increase in the rooftop solar capacity, a ground-mounted solar PV capacity of 152 MW, which could be allocated to 18 grid substations has been identified. The Cabinet approved the proposal made by the Minister of Energy, to reserve the entire grid capacity of 152 MW exclusively for the international competitive bidding process and initiate the process of calling for bids by issuing Requests for Proposals to procure electricity from prospective project developers on Build, Own and Operate basis.

title: Signing of a Memorandum of Understanding between the the Viet Nam Trade Promotion Agency and the Sri Lanka Export Development Board
decision_details: - It has been proposed to sign a Memorandum of Understanding  between the Vietnam Trade Promotion Agency and the Sri Lanka Export Development Board to strengthen trade cooperation between Sri Lanka and Viet Nam. The MoU will provide space for a wide range of trade promotion activities, including the exchange of trade-related information and market intelligence, joint participation in trade fairs, exhibitions and promotional events held in both countries, and the organization of meetings between business delegations. It is expected that this cooperation will provide tangible market opportunities for processed foods, fisheries, apparel and value-added agriculture, in particular. The concurrence of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs, Foreign Employment and Tourism has been received for the draft MoU. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Industry and Entrepreneurship Development to sign the relevant MoU between the Viet Nam Trade Promotion Agency and the Sri Lanka Export Development Board, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Renewal of the Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) on Machinery  Manufacturing Cooperation between the Ministry of Industry and Entrepreneurship Development of Sri Lanka 	and the Ministry of Industry and Trade of Viet Nam
decision_details: - A Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) was signed between the then Ministry in charge of the subject of Industry and the Ministry of Industry and Trade of the Socialist Republic of Vietnam in 2011 to promote bilateral cooperation in the Machinery and Mechanical appliances sector, including the Electrical Machinery and Equipment Manufacturing between the two countries. At the second meeting of the Sub-Committee on Trade between the two countries held in 2019, both parties have agreed to renew the said MoU. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Industry and Entrepreneurship Development to sign the updated Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) on Machinery Manufacturing Cooperation, which was amended facilitating the exchange of advanced technologies and providing access to training and capacity building activities for local stakeholders, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) between the Bandaranaike International Diplomatic Training Institute of Sri Lanka and the Diplomatic Academy of Viet Nam "
decision_details: - An agreement has been reached between the Bandaranaike International Diplomatic Training Institute operating under the the Ministry of Foreign Affairs, Foreign Employment and Tourism of Sri Lanka and the Diplomatic Academy of Viet Nam with the objective of establishing institutional relations with a view to maintaining mutually useful cooperation in the areas of common interest in order to bring together innovative ideas and opinions in the bilateral, regional and international affairs closely connected with each other in the complex contemporary world. It is proposed to sign a Memorandum of Understanding for this purpose and facilitation of sharing expertise, exchange of diplomats, academics, officials, experts and researchers, as well as the organizing and exchanging expertise related to programmes of study and research, various courses, seminars, other academic activities and training in the field of diplomacy is expected through this. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Foreign Affairs, Foreign Employment and Tourism to sign a Memorandum of Understanding between the two parties, which will be valid for a period of three (03) years, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Appointment to the Post of Commissioner General of Official Languages
decision_details: - The Post of Commissioner General of Official Languages has fallen vacant due to the appointment of Mr. W. Prince Senadheera, Special Grade Officer in the Sri Lanka Administrative Service who served in the said Post, to the Post of the Secretary, Ministry of Buddhasasana, Religious and Cultural Affairs. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Justice and National Integration to appoint Mr. Thilak Nandana Hettiarachchi, Special  Grade Officer in the Sri Lanka Administrative Service, presently serving as the Additional Secretary (Cultural Promotions) in the Ministry of Buddhasasana, Religious and Cultural Affairs to the Post of Commissioner General of Official Languages with immediate effect, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Introducing new Laws and amendments to the existing Acts in respect of the scope of the Ministry of Plantation and Community Infrastructure
decision_details:
- It has been identified the need of amending the existing Acts and formulation of new Acts within the year 2025 in accordance with the priorities of Government policies related to the scope of the Ministry of Plantations and Community Infrastructure. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Plantations and Community Infrastructure to incorporate the introducing of the following new laws and the amendment of the Acts, in the Legislation Programme of the Government for the year 2025, was approved by the Cabinet:

* Amendments to the Tea, Rubber and Coconut Estates (Control of Fragmentation) Act, No. 2 of 1958
* Amendments to the Saumyamoorthi Thondaman Memorial Foundation Act, No. 19 of 2005
* Amendments to the Tea Shakthi Fund Act, No. 47 of 2000
* Amendments to the Tea Control Act, No. 51 of 1957
* Amendments to the Rubber Control Act, No. 11 of 1956
* Introduction of a new Act as the Plantation Management Act
* Introduction of a new Act to assign the authority of the Thurusaviya	 Societies to the Rubber Development Department
* Making amendments to the Coconut Development Act, No. 46 of 1971 enabling to introduce new Regulations to the Act, based on the current needs.
* Making amendments to the Sri Lanka Tea Board Act, No. 14 of 1975 and related Regulations.

title: Amendment of the Rubber Control Act, No. 11 of 1956
decision_details: - Approval has been granted at the Cabinet meeting held on 2024‑02‑26 to publish the Bill prepared by the Legal Draftsman and cleared by the Attorney General  to amend the  Rubber Control Act, No. 11 of 1956, in the Government Gazette and submit the same to Parliament.  The said Bill has been published in the Government Gazette on 2024‑05‑22. Nevertheless, the said Bill could not be presented to Parliament due to the dissolution of Parliament on 2024‑09‑24. Therefore, the proposal made by the Minister of Plantation and Community Infrastructure to re-publish the Bill prepared by the Legal Draftsman to amend the Rubber Control Act, No. 11 of 1956 in the Government Gazette and submit the same, thereafter to Parliament for approval, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Amendment of Acts falling under the purview of the institutions under the Ministry of Industry and Entrepreneurship Development
decision_details:
- It is planned to amend certain Acts falling under the purview of the institutions operating under the Ministry of Industry and Entrepreneurship Development in this year with a view of creating a strong and suitable institutional structure to accelerate the economic transformation of Sri Lanka.  Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Industry and Entrepreneurship Development to amend the following Acts and to include the amendments to the said Acts to the Legislation Programme of the Government in the year 2025, was approved by the Cabinet. 

    • National Gem and Jewellery Authority Act, No. 50 of 1993
    • Industrial Development Act, No. 36 of 1969
    • The Sri Lanka Institute of Textile and Apparel Act, No. 12 of 2009 
    • Sri Lanka Export Development Act, No. 40 of 1979 
    • National Enterprise Development Authority Act, No. 17 of 2006
    • National Enterprise Development Authority (Amendment) Act, No. 18 of 2014
    • National Crafts Council and Allied Institutions Act, No. 35 of 1982
    • National Crafts Council and Allied Institutions (Special Provisions) Act, No. 4 of 1996

title: State Vesak Festival of 2569 B.E.
decision_details: - In accordance with the admonitions of the Most Ven. Mahanayaka Theros and the Samastha Lanka Shasanarakshaka Mandalaya, it has been identified that it is appropriate to conduct the State Vesak Festival of 2569 B.E. (2025) at the Nuwara Eliya International Buddhist Centre Temple centralizing Nuwara Eliya District, jointly with the Ministry of Buddhasasana, Religious and Cultural Affairs, the Ministry of Public Administration, Provincial Councils and Local Government and the Department of Buddhist Affairs. It has been decided to hold this year's State Vesak Festival under the theme "Bhajetha miththe kalyane - Bhajetha purisuththame" (Associate with noble friends with virtues). Accordingly, the joint proposal made by the Minister of Public Administration, Provincial Councils and Local Government and the Minister of Buddhasasana, Religious and Cultural Affairs to hold the National Vesak Festival centralizing Nuwara Eliya International Buddhist Centre Temple, to declare the Vesak Week from 10th to 16th of May 2025  and to organize and implement various Buddhist programmes during the said period, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Establishment of a fully atomated income generating system for the Colombo Municipal Council under the aid of the Korea International Cooperation Agency
decision_details: - The Colombo Municipal Council generates a high income through four (04) main income sources, namely Assessment Tax, License Tax, Trade Tax and Stamp Duty. The Colombo Municipal Council, the Ministry of Public Administration, Provincial Councils and Local Government and the Department of External Resources have jointly submitted a Concept Paper to the Korea International Cooperation Agency to improve the overall income generation by automation of these four income sources. The Korea International Cooperation Agency has agreed to provide a grant of USD 8.5 million for this purpose. The clearance of the Attorney General and the concurrence of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs, Foreign Employment and Tourism and the Department of External Resources have been obtained for the said Record of Discussion. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Public Administration, Provincial Councils and Local Government to enter into the Record of Discussion for the implementation of the Income Generation Automation Project of the Colombo Municipal Council utilizing the assistance provided by the Korean International Cooperation Agency, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Economic Census - 2025/26
decision_details: - The Economic Census was last conducted by the Department of Census and Statistics in the years 2013/14. The Department has planned to conduct the Economic Census in the years 2025 and 2026, covering agricultural and non-agricultural economic activities in two phases separately to update the data collected in that census. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Hon. President in his capacity as the Minister of Finance, Planning and Economic Development to conduct the Economic Census in the years 2025 and 2026 covering the enumeration of agricultural activities in the year 2025 and non-agricultural activities in the year 2026, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Memorandum of Understanding between the Ministry of Education, Higher Education and Vocational Education and the National University of Singapore for Higher Education Collaboration
decision_details: - It has been proposed to enter into a Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) between the National University of Singapore, Republic of Singapore, which is ranked at a top position in global university rankings and the Ministry of Education, Higher Education and Vocational Education of Sri Lanka to establish higher education collaborations including the access to Postgraduate scholarship opportunities for Graduate students in Sri Lanka. Entering into the proposed MoU will enable Sri Lankan students to pursue Postgraduate Degrees including Doctoral Degrees at the National University of Singapore, participate in capacity building programmes and conduct joint research. The proposal made by the Hon. Prime Minister in her capacity as the Minister of Education, Higher Education and Vocational Education to sign the said MoU, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Establishment of the Cabinet Appointed Special Committee on Economic Management
decision_details: - The Government anticipates to achieve an economic growth rate over 5% of the real Gross Domestic Production (GDP) over the medium term. The Government has focused its attention on investment-friendly policy formulation, infrastructure development and export diversification to achieve sustainable economic growth and economic stability. However, since private investment has been at a low level over the past few decades and the Government investment is about 4%-5% of the GDP, it has been identified that promoting private sector investment is essential to achieve the targeted economic growth. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Hon. President to establish the Cabinet Appointed Special Committee on Economic Management to oversee and facilitate policy discussions on economic development, ensuring efficiency and alignment with national economic objectives, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Appointment to the Post of Commissioner General of the Department of Motor Traffic
decision_details: - Mr. Nishantha Anuruddha Weerasinghe, Special Grade Officer of the Sri Lanka Administrative Service who is currently serving as the Commissioner General of Motor Traffic, has requested to be released from the duties of the post of Commissioner General of Motor Traffic, enabling him to serve in a post in another field in the Public Service. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Transport, Highways, Ports and Civil Aviation to attach                                   Mr. Nishantha Anuruddha Weerasinghe to the Ministry of Public Administration, Provincial Council and Local Government with immediate effect, enabling to be appointed to another suitable post and to appoint                            Mr. Kamal Amarasinghe, Special Grade Officer of the Sri Lanka Administrative Service who is presently serving as the Secretary, Ministry of Road, Transport, Housing and Construction, Industrial and Rural Development, North Western Province, to the Post of Commissioner General of Motor Traffic thus falling vacant, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Regulations under the provisions of the Anti-Corruption Act, No.9 of 2023
decision_details: - The Anti-Corruption Act, No.9 of 2023, has been enacted to give effect to certain provisions of the United Nations Convention against Corruption and other internationally recognized norms, standards and best practices and to provide for the establishment of an independent Commission to detect and investigate allegations of bribery, corruption and offenses related to the declaration of assets and liabilities and associated offenses. The Minister shall make Regulations in consultation with the Commission, in respect of matters required by the Act to be prescribed or in respect of which Regulations are authorized to be made. Approval has been granted at the Cabinet meeting held on 2025‑03‑17 to publish the Regulations so made in consultation with the Commission to Investigate Allegations of Bribery or Corruption, in the Government Gazette. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Justice and National Integration to submit the Anti-Corruption (Declaration of Assets and Liabilities) Regulations 2025 published through the Extraordinary Gazette Notification No.2428/43 dated 2025‑03‑20, for approval of Parliament, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Making provisions for the registration of electric motor tricycles (three-wheelers)
decision_details: - With the use of rechargeable batteries in manufacturing motor tricycles (three‑ wheelers) powered by electricity and converting motor tricycles powered by petrol or diesel (three - wheelers) into electric powered motor tricycles, the tare weight of such motor tricycles (three - wheelers) increases. Therefore, approval of the Cabinet has been granted at the Cabinet meeting held on 2022‑08‑08 to amend the definition in the Motor Traffic Act as the maximum tare weight of a motor tricycles (three - wheelers) as 600 kg, in order to resolve the interpretation issues arising during the registration of such motor tricycles (three-wheelers). However, taking into account the need to introduce a battery system that is capable of covering longer distances on a single charge, the need for a battery system with a higher capacity for air-conditioned luxury motor tricycles (three‑wheelers), and the added weight when using electric resistance - operated brakes, local manufacturers engaged in the production and conversion of electric motor tricycles (three-wheelers) have requested the Department of Motor Traffic to revise the definition in such a manner that the tare weight of an electric powered motor tricycle (three-wheeler), including the weight of the battery system shall not exceed 650 kg. Accordingly, taking into consideration the proposal made by the Minister of Transport, Highways, Ports and Civil Aviation, it was decided to grant policy approval of the Cabinet to amend the Motor Traffic Act incorporating the proposed amendment.

title: Establishment of the Gambling Regulatory Authority
decision_details: - It has been proposed to establish the Gambling Regulatory Authority to function as the sole independent regulator with a broad and overarching scope on operations in the gambling industry in Sri Lanka including online and off‑shore gambling activities on ships and in the Colombo Port City. Clearance of the Attorney General has been received for the Bill prepared as per the approval granted by the Cabinet on 2025‑02‑24 to prepare a Bill for the same. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Hon. President in his capacity as the Minister of Finance, Planning and Economic Development to publish the Gambling Regulatory Authority Bill in the Government Gazette and submit the same thereafter, to Parliament for approval, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Renovation of the Karainagar Boatyard, owned by Cey-Nor Foundation Limited
decision_details: - During the official visit made by the Hon. President in India in the month of December 2024, a Memorandum of Understanding was signed to obtain a Grant from the Government of India to renovate the Karainagar Boatyard. In terms of the said Memorandum of Understanding, the Government of Sri Lanka has been charged with the responsibility of securing technical consultancy services for the project and for exempting taxes on the goods and equipment relevant to the said Grant. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Fisheries, Aquatic and Ocean Resources to obtain the service of the Central Engineering Consultancy Bureau as the Consultant of the Project and to allocate Rs. 40 million from the General Treasury for expenses to be incurred by the Government of Sri Lanka, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Awarding of contract for Ground Handling Services of SriLankan Airlines Limited at Melbourne Airport in Australia
decision_details: - The existing contract for the provision of ground handling services at the Melbourne Airport, Australia is due to expire on 2025‑06‑30. Therefore, limited international competitive bids have been invited to select a ground handling service provider for the next 03 years. The Standing High Level Procurement Committee, after reviewing four (04) bids received for the same has recommended that the relevant contract be awarded to Dnata Airport Services Pty Limited. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Hon. President in his capacity as the Minister of Finance, Planning and Economic Development, to award the contract for the provision of ground handling services (Passenger, Ramp and Cargo Warehouse handling) for SriLankan Airlines at Melbourne Airport, to the said company at a total estimated cost of AUD 13,124,402, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Increasing the grant provided for a Housing Unit under "Obata Geyak - Ratata Hetak" Housing Programme
decision_details: - "Obata Geyak - Ratata Hetak" Housing Programme is implemented with the objective of reducing the housing problem and related poverty among poor or low income earners. Under the said programme, a poor or low income family in each Grama Niladhari Division is identified on priority basis and a grant would be provided to construct/improve a house based on the progress of construction. The selected beneficiary should construct a house at least with 550 square feet and in addition to the Rs.650,000/- which is provided by the Government for the same, the balance amount has to be borne by the relevant beneficiary. At the commencement of the programme, the estimated cost of a house was Rs.1,147,000/-, but as of now, the said cost has increased up to Rs.1,764,000/-. Since the selected beneficiaries are not in a position to bear the balance amount in addition to the Government grant as per their economic condition, the proposal made by the Minister of Urban Development, Construction and Housing to increase the Government grant of Rs.650,000/- being paid for a housing unit at present up to Rs.1,000,000/-, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Promoting tourism and passenger transportation activities using 	waterways under Public-Private Partnership
decision_details: - Since Sri Lanka is an island blessed with water sources and waterways, it is possible to utilize those water sources and waterways for promotion of the tourism industry as well as urban passenger transportation. Therefore, attention has been focused on starting a boat service covering several areas using the country's coastal waters as well as the inland waterways. Accordingly, it is expected to facilitate tourism promotion and passenger transportation by establishing a marine transport service as Puttalam - Fort, Fort - Galle, Galle - Matara, etc. and establish required infrastructure facilities for the purpose. Similarly, it is expected to promote the tourism industry by providing inland water transportation facilities using potentials such as Hamilton Canal, Beira Lake, Diyawanna Oya and Madu Ganga. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Foreign Affairs, Foreign Employment and Tourism to conduct a feasibility study on the implementation of the relevant project and to implement the proposed project as a Public-Private Partnership programme, based on its outcome, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Obtaining approval of the new Cabinet for the Bill for the Protection of New Plant Variety Rights
decision_details: - Although, the Intellectual Property Act, No.36 of 2003 provides legal provisions related to copyright, industrial designs, patent rights, brands and business names, etc., there are no provisions for the protection of plant variety rights (pertaining to breeders, researchers and farmers). Further, according to the provisions of the Intellectual Property Act, patent rights cannot be granted for plants and animals. Therefore, approval has been granted to introduce a new Act for the protection of new plant variety rights at the Cabinet meeting held on 2024-05-22. Accordingly, the Legal Draftsman has pointed out that policy approval of the present Cabinet has to be obtained to finalize the preparation of the Bill for the protection of new plant variety rights. The proposal made by the Minister of Agriculture, Livestock, Lands and Irrigation to grant the approval of the Cabinet to finalize the said Bill, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Submission of the Gazette Notifications for the approval of Parliament
decision_details:
- The proposal made by the Hon. President in his capacity as the Minister of Finance, Planning and Economic Development to submit the following Regulation/Orders published through the Government Gazette, for approval of Parliament, was approved by the Cabinet.

*	Regulation made on the revision of the Luxury Tax Threshold on Motor vehicles under the Finance Act, No.35 of 2018, published through the Gazette Extraordinary Notification No. 2421/41 dated 2025-01-31.

*	Order made under the Excise (Special Provisions) Act, No.13 of 1989, pertaining to the revision of the Excise Duty Rates on electric vehicles, published by the Gazette Extraordinary Notification No. 2421/42 dated 2025-01-31.

*	Order made under the Finance Act, No.35 of 2018, pertaining to the extension of the concessionary period granted under the Embarkation Levy	published through the Gazette Extraordinary Notification No.2421/30 dated 2025-01-31.

title: Procurement for the supply of 70,000 vials of 5g-6g Human 	Immunoglobulin for Intravenous use
decision_details: - International Competitive Bids have been invited to procure 70,000 vials of 5g-6g Human Immunoglobulin for intravenous use, which is used to treat the patients with immune deficiencies. Six (06) bids have been received for the purpose. The proposal made by the Minister of Health and Mass Media to award the relevant procurement to M/s Reliance Life Sciences (Pvt) Ltd., India, the substantially responsive lowest evaluated bidder for a sum of USD 6.86 million, based on the recommendation of the Standing High-Level Procurement Committee, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Procurement for the supply of 3 million inactivated doses of Rabies Vaccine (Human Use) in 0.5ml/1 ml
decision_details: - International Competitive Bids have been invited under the procurement for the supply of 3 million inactivated doses of Rabies Vaccine in 0.5ml/1 ml used to treat for the prevention of Rabies. 05 bids have been received for the same. The proposal made by the Minister of Health and Mass Media to award the relevant procurement to M/s Gulf Pharma (Pvt) Ltd., Sri Lanka, (Manufacturer: M/s Chiron Behring Vaccine (Pvt) Ltd, India), the lowest evaluated substantially responsive bidder, based on the recommendation of the Standing High Level Procurement Committee, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Procurement process for the purchase of Pre-Printed Polycarbonate 	Cards for the issuance of National Identity Cards
decision_details: - The Department for Registration of Persons has commenced using Smart Cards for the issuance of National Identity Cards in the year 2017. Under the new method introduced by the Electronic National Identity Card (e-NIC) project to be implemented in the future, an electronic National Identity Card has to be issued to all Sri Lankan citizens who have completed 15 years of age. It has been identified that there is a need of around 17 million cards to re-register Sri Lankan citizens and issue a new identity card. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Hon. President in his capacity as the Minister of Digital Economy to purchase 15 million Polycarbonate Cards, following the international competitive bidding method, to meet the said requirement, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Awarding the contract for the purchase of 05 shipments of  Gasoline 92 Unl during the period from 2025 04 15 to 2025 10 14
decision_details: - Bids have been invited form the registered suppliers of the Ceylon Petroleum Corporation to purchase 05 shipments of Gasoline 92 Unl 300,000+/-5% each for a period of six(06) months from 2025.04.15 to 2025.10.14. Seven (07) suppliers have submitted bids for the purpose. The proposal made by the Minister of Energy, to award the said procurement to M/s Vitol Asia Pte.Ltd., Singapore, the substantially responsive lowest evaluated bidder, based on the recommendations of the Standing Technical Evaluation Committee and the Special Standing Cabinet Appointed Procurement Committee, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Selection of investors for the development of lands belonging to the Urban Development Authority
decision_details:
- The Cabinet has decided previously that the formal Procurement Procedure should be followed to select suitable investors when setting apart lands belonging to the Urban Development Authority on  long-term lease basis for the implementation of development projects. Accordingly, the proposals made by the Minister of Urban Development, Construction and Housing to follow the Procurement Procedures to select suitable investors to set apart the following plots of land, which have been transferred to the Urban Development Authority under section 6(1) of the State Land Ordinance, on long-term lease basis, adhering to the Planning Regulations of the Urban Development Authority, based on the valuation of the Government Valuer:

* 	to set apart the plot of land with an extent of 03 Acres, 2 Roods, 24.59		Perches from the land located in Dematagoda (537 Watta), on 99-year long-term lease basis.

title: Submission of the Report on the Deviation of Headline Inflation from the Inflation Target set out in the Monetary Policy Framework Agreement during the Third and Fourth Quarters of 2024  to Parliament
decision_details: - In accordance with the Monetary Policy Framework Agreement signed between the Hon. Minister of Finance and the Central Bank of Sri Lanka on 2023 10 03 under section 26(1) of the Central Bank of Sri Lanka Act No. 16 of 2023,  the Central Bank of Sri Lanka has been charged with the responsibility of maintaining the quarterly  headline inflation measured by the Colombo Consumer Price Index (CCPI) compiled by the Department of Census and Statistics, at the rate of 5%. As per section 26(5) of the Central Bank of Sri Lanka Act No. 16 of 2023, in case the Central Bank of Sri Lanka fails to meet the said inflation targets from margin specified for two consecutive quarters, the Monetary Board of the Central Bank of Sri Lanka is required to submit a Report in that regard to Parliament through the Minister in charge of the subject of Finance. Likewise the General Public shall have access to the same. Average of the quarterly headline inflation based on the Colombo Consumer Price Index, has been recorded as 0.8% and -1.5% during the third and fourth quarters in the year 2024 respectively and it remains below 2% less than the inflation target for consecutive two quarters. As such, the proposal made by the Hon. President in his capacity as the Minister of Finance, Planning and Economic Development to table the  Report on the Deviation of Headline Inflation Target submitted to the Minister in charge of the subject of Finance under section 26(5) of the Central Bank of Sri Lanka, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Signing of a Tripartite Memorandum of Understanding among 	the South Asian Centre for Teacher Development (SACTD), 	UNESCO South Asia Regional Office (SARO) and Indira Gandhi 	National Open University (IGNOU)
decision_details: - The South Asian Centre for Teacher Development has been established as an autonomous and self-financed institution. The UNESCO Executive Board has recommended that the functions of the said Centre should be upgraded to promote its work and establish partnerships with other institutions and organizations in the region. Accordingly, it has been proposed to sign a Tripartite Agreement among the South Asian Centre for Teacher Development, the UNESCO South Asia Regional Office and the Indira Gandhi National Open University aiming to introduce a new high quality training programme on Media and Information Literacy thereby further developing regional cooperation and strengthening national and regional action plans, including the targets outlined in the 2030 Agenda for Sustainable Development. The clearance of the Attorney General has been received for the proposed draft MoU. The approval of the Cabinet was granted for the proposal made by the Hon. Prime Minister in her capacity as the Minister of Education, Higher Education and Vocational Education to sign the said Tripartite Memorandum of Understanding.

title: Appointment to the Post of District Secretary/Government Agent in the 	Administrative District of Kegalle
decision_details: - Since Mr. J.M.R.P. Jayasinghe, who served as the District Secretary/Government Agent in the Administrative District of Kegalle, has been appointed to the Post of Chief Secretary of the North Central Province with effect from 2025‑02‑01, the Post of District Secretary/Government Agent, Kegalle has fallen vacant by now. It has been identified that it would be appropriate to appoint Mr. H.M.J.M. Herath, Special Grade Officer of the Sri Lanka Administrative Service, presently serving in a Post of Additional Secretary of the Ministry of Public Administration, Provincial Councils and Local Government, to the said Post.  Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Public Administration, Provincial Councils and Local Government to appoint Mr. H.M.J.M. Herath, Special Grade Officer of the Sri Lanka Administrative Service, to the Post of District Secretary/Government Agent in the Administrative District of Kegalle with immediate effect, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Amendments to the Tea Control Act, No.51 of 1957
Amendment to the Industrial Promotion Act No.46 of 1990
decision_details: - It has been observed that the provisions of the existing Industrial Promotion Act No. 46 of 1990 are inadequate for the formulation of industrial policies to meet the timely requirements in the industry sector in relation to the fields of technology, trade, skills and environment etc. Therefore, approval has been granted at the Cabinet meeting held on 2021‑03‑08 to amend the said Act. The Legal Draftsman is making amendments to the said Act at present and the need of obtaining policy concurrence of the present Cabinet for amending the said Act has been pointed out by the Legal Draftsman. Accordingly, taking into consideration the proposal made by the Minister of Industry and Entrepreneurship Development, it was decided to grant policy approval of the Cabinet to expedite the preparation of the said Bill.

title: Payment of annual contributions to the International Solar Alliance (ISA) and signing of the Country Partnership Framework (CPF) between Sri Lanka and ISA
decision_details:
- The International Solar Alliance has been established with the aim of supporting the member nations pathway to promote the use of solar energy. At present, 75 countries, including Sri Lanka, have become its members and 54 countries have ratified the Partnership Framework Agreement. Sri Lanka is required to pay a voluntary contribution of US$ 25,000 annually based on the category to which it belongs. As a member State, Sri Lanka has the opportunity to accrue benefits such as capacity building relating to solar energy sector through Solar Technology Application Resource Centres (STAR-C), Policy Development, Access to Funding, Global Networking, Knowledge Exchange, from the International Solar Alliance. Accordingly, the following proposals made by the Minister of Energy, were approved by the Cabinet:

*	to continue the payment of an annual contribution of US$ 25,000 from the financial year 2024/25 onwards.

*	to establish a Solar Technology Application Resource Centre (STAR-C) in Sri Lanka.

*	to sign the 'Country Partnership Framework' between Sri Lanka and the International Solar Alliance.

title: Construction of a Lawyers' Office Complex acquired adjacent to the New Galle Courts Complex
decision_details:
- Proposal pertaining to the construction of a Lawyers' Office Complex at the expense of the Galle Bar Association on a plot of land in extent of 130 perches adjacent to the New Galle Courts Complex acquired for the use of the Ministry in charge of the subject of Justice, was taken up for discussion at the Cabinet meeting held on 2025‑02‑03. At this meeting, an Officials' Committee headed by the Secretary, Ministry of Justice and National Integration, comprising of representatives from the Ministry of Finance Planning and Economic Development, Land Commissioner General's Department including other relevant institutions, has been appointed to examine the existing legal and other matters pertaining to the implementation of the said proposal and submit a Report with recommendations to the Cabinet. The proposal made by the Minister of Justice and National Integration to sign a Memorandum of Understanding between the Ministry of Justice and National Integration and the Galle Bar Association to pursue action as follows, based on the recommendations submitted by the said Officials' Committee, was approved by the Cabinet.

*	Construction of a Lawyers' Office Complex through the funds of the Galle Bar Association on the above plot of land in extent of 130 perches, having the ownership of the land with the Government.

*	Handing over the tenure of the said building to the Galle Bar Association to use the same for a period of 30 years, attending to its maintenance, in a manner that the total amount invested by the said Association for the construction of the building is covered by the lease rental.

*	Not to use the building for any commercial purpose other than providing servìces to the public in relation to the legal profession.

*	Handover of the tenure of the building to the Ministry in charge of the subject of Justice after a period of 30 years.

*	If the said building is further required thereafter, to provide the opportunity to use the said building, having entered into a fresh Memorandum of Understanding with the Galle Bar Association, based on the valuation of the Chief Government Valuer.

title: Legal status regarding changing the design and modification of buses
decision_details: - In keeping with the Regulations issued under the provisions of the Motor Traffic Act, changes in the design of vehicles and their modifications could be made with the prior approval of the Commissioner General of Motor Traffic. Accordingly, by amending the Motor Traffic (Construction of Vehicles) Regulations published in 1983, from time to time, Regulations regarding the manner in which such modifications can be made, have been published through Gazette Notifications. In addition to the installation of vehicle accessories and changes in the design published through such Regulations in the past, the Department of Motor Traffic has also prepared a set of guidelines for decoration of buses and modification of components through different internal procedures and an internal circular too has been issued thereon. However, no Regulations related thereto have been published in accordance with the provisions of the Motor Traffic Act. Therefore, Cabinet decided to grant its concurrence for the proposal made by the Minister of Transport, Highways, Ports and Civil Aviation to appoint a Committee representing the Ministry of Transport, Highways, Ports and Civil Aviation including other relevant parties, to examine the possible impact of bus decorations and accessories on the safety of passengers travelling in buses, taking all these circumstances into account and submit a Report with recommendations for taking appropriate measures in this regard.

title: Acceptance of the Manifesto 'A Thriving Nation - A Beautiful Life ' as the National Policy Framework of the Government
decision_details:
- The manifesto ' A Thriving Nation - A Beautiful Life ' has been put forward with a view to attaining sustainable economic growth and development through a robust production economy with a target of reaching a real Gross Domestic Production of US$ 120 billion by 2030. It has been structured under four main sectors stated below encompassing all sectors including economic, social, environmental, political:

*	A fulfilling life - A comfortable country

*	An honorable life - A safer country

*	A modern life - A wealthy nation

*	A dignified life - A strong country

	Forty (40) sub-sectors have been identified under those 04 main sectors, and the policy principles and actions to be taken pertaining to the said areas have been identified separately. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Hon. President in his capacity as the Minister of Finance, Planning and Economic Development to accept the manifesto "A Thriving Nation - A Beautiful Life" as the National Policy Framework of the Government and to direct the Ministries, Departments, State Institutions, Provincial Councils and Local Authorities to plan and implement their functions accordingly, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Appointment to the Post of Director General of the Disaster Management Centre
decision_details: - The contract period of service of retired Major General, H.M.U. Herath presently serving in the Post of Director General of the Disaster Management Centre is due to expire on 2025‑03‑07. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Hon. President in his capacity as the Minister of Defence, to appoint retired Major General Sampath Kotuwegoda for a period of one (01) year on contract basis, to the Post of Director General of the Disaster Management Centre, which falls vacant from the said date, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Ratification of UNESCO (2005) Convention on the Protection and Promotion of the Diversity of Cultural Expressions by Sri Lanka
decision_details: - UNESCO has adopted a Convention on the Protection and Promotion of the Diversity of Cultural Expressions created in its Member States on 2005‑10‑20, which has come into force on 2007-03-10. The Convention has been ratified by 156 Member States as of now. Although the approval of the Cabinet at its meeting held on 2024‑09‑09, has been granted to ratify the said Convention by Sri Lanka, it has not yet been ratified. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Buddhasasana, Religious and Cultural Affairs seeking policy approval to ratify the UNESCO (2005) Convention on the Protection and Promotion of the Diversity of Cultural Expressions by Sri Lanka, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Extension of the validity period of the Asian Development Bank Loan and Grant for the Health System Enhancement Project
decision_details: - The Health System Enhancement Project has been implemented in two (02) phases with the Asian Development Bank funding, aiming to improve the efficiency, equity and responsiveness of the Primary Healthcare System in the Central, North Central, Uva and Sabaragamuwa Provinces. The original financing for the project consists of a loan of US$ 37.5 million and a grant of US$ 12.5 million. In addition, a loan of US$ 110 million and a grant of US$ 3 million have been obtained as additional financing of the project. The need to extend the validity period of the loan and grant obtained under the original financing for the project by another year has been identified in order to fully utilize the said loan and the grant. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Health and Mass Media to extend the validity period of the original loan and grant of the Health System Enhancement Project up to 2025‑11‑30 and the date of closure of the loan up to 2026‑05‑31, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Allocating lands required for the Siyabalanduwa 100MW Solar Power Project, to the Sustainable Energy Authority of Sri Lanka on Grant Basis
decision_details: - The Government expects to meet 70% of the country's electricity demand from renewable energy sources by 2030. In accordance with the said policy, the Siyambalanduwa 100 MW Solar Power Park facility has been identified as one of the key projects. A land area of 219.7233 hectares not used for farming or other cultivations, has been identified for the implementation of the project. Considering the strategic importance of the proposed project and enabling to expeditiously implement the project, the proposal made by the Minister of Energy to allocate the land in extent of 219.7233 hectares as a Grant to the Sustainable Energy Authority of Sri Lanka, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Development of twenty-four (24) Nos. of Tanks in the Trincomalee Upper Tank Farm
decision_details: - The Government of Sri Lanka, the Ceylon Petroleum Corporation, Lanka IOC and Trinco Petroleum Terminal (Pvt) Ltd have signed an Agreement on 2022-01-06 for the possession, development and use of the China Bay Oil Tank Farm. As per the provisions of the said Agreement, twenty-four (24) tanks at the Trincomalee Upper Tank Farm have been leased out to the Ceylon Petroleum Corporation for a period of 50 years from the effective date of the Agreement. With the aim of completing the development of the said oil tanks within 03 years, a three-year project has been planned and preliminary project work including a feasibility study has been carried out by the Ceylon Petroleum Corporation. The approvals of the relevant parties including the Road Development Authority, Sri Lanka Railways, Marine Environment Protection Authority have been obtained as of now, for the said project. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Energy to implement the proposed project using the funds of the Ceylon Petroleum Corporation without causing a burden to the General Treasury, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: The Project for Strengthening Surveillance of Cancer through Population Based Cancer Registry (PBCR) Programme in selected districts
decision_details: - The Data for Health (D4H) Initiative, funded by Bloomberg Philanthropies and the Australian Government, provides technical assistance to more than 20 low - and middle-income countries to strengthen the collection and use of critical public health information. Vital Strategies, which is working in collaboration with the Initiative, has so far implemented 03 programmes while operating as the lead technical partner of the Data for Health Initiative in Sri Lanka. As the next programme under this Initiative, Vital Strategies has agreed to provide technical assistance to Strengthen Surveillance of Cancer through Population Based Cancer Registry in selected districts in Sri Lanka. Under the proposed project, it is expected to spend about Rs.19.50 million for the activities identified through its fiscal agency in Sri Lanka, the Health Informatics Society of Sri Lanka. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Health and Mass Media to sign a Memorandum of Understanding between Vital Strategies and the Ministry of Health and Mass Media to implement the proposed project, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Conducting the International Water Conference (IWC) and 9th Research Symposium and Celebration of the World Water Day 2025
decision_details: - The National Water Supply and Drainage Board (NWSDB) had held its first Research Symposium in 2015, with a special focus on water pollution and human health servìces. Since then, the said symposium has been held continuously until 2022, in collaboration with local institutions and individuals. In the year 2022, the National Water Supply and Drainage Board established the Centre of Excellence for Water and Sanitation and has held the International Water Conference-2022 and the 7th Research Symposium with the participation of local and foreign guests as well. Nine (09) countries had participated in the International Water Conference and the 8th Research Symposium held in 2023. The International Water Conference - 2025 and the 9th Research Symposium under the theme "Sustainable Water and Wastewater Management; through Innovation, Research, Digitalization and Resilience for the Future:" are planned to be held on 19th and 20th March 2025 at the Centre of Excellence for Water and Sanitation. A programme has also been planned for 21st March to celebrate World Water Day which falls on 22nd March and to celebrate the 50th anniversary of the National Water Supply and Drainage Board concurrently with the International Water Conference. It is expected to present about 100 international and local researches at the Research Symposium and more than 600 participants representing local and foreign institutions would attend the said Symposium. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Urban Development, Construction and Housing to the implement the said programmes, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Appointing a Committee to oversee the implementation of the 	recommendations proposed to control the flood situation in Kolonnawa
decision_details: - At the Cabinet meeting held on 2024-06-03, it had been decided to appoint a Committee headed by the District Secretary, Colombo  to examine the measures to be taken regarding the damages caused by the floods in the Kolonnawa Divisional Secretariat Division in June 2024, to investigate the root causes of the floods in that area and submit a Report containing necessary recommendations to prevent the recurrence of such a situation, and to prepare a comprehensive development plan for the reorganization of the Kolonnawa Town. Accordingly, the Cabinet decided to appoint a Committee under the Chairmanship of the Hon. Prime Minister and with the membership of the relevant Ministers in charge of the subject and with the participation of other relevant authorities to provide necessary guidance and to oversee the expeditious implementation of the recommendations of the Report submitted by the said Committee, on a priority basis.

title: Amending the Convention against Doping in Sports Act, No.33 of 2013
decision_details: - The Sri Lanka Anti-Doping Agency (SLADA) is an institution that operates based on the laws and regulations of the World Anti-Doping Agency (WADA). The Sri Lanka Anti-Doping Agency should adhere to the said laws and regulations to ensure that Sri Lankan sports persons can compete in international sport events. The World Anti-Doping Agency periodically reviews the anti-doping laws of each country from time to time to ensure that they are up to the expected level and recommends amendments to be made. The Convention Against Doping in Sports Act No. 33 of 2013 has been drafted, having adopted the international provisions existed in the year 2013. The World Anti-Doping Agency has recommended a number of amendments to the Anti-Doping Act of Sri Lanka for the year 2024, after reviewing the Anti-Doping Law of Sri Lanka.  Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Youth Affairs and Sports to instruct the Legal Draftsman to prepare a Bill to amend the Convention Against Doping in Sports Act, No. 33 of 2013, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Establishment of the Gambling Regulatory Authority
decision_details: - Approval of the Cabinet has been granted at its meeting held on 2023.06.26 to establish the Gambling Regulatory Authority as an overarching, independent regulator with a broad and comprehensive scope to standardize betting and gaming establishments in Sri Lanka, mitigate social harm and promote tourism sector and economic growth, and to instruct the Legal Draftsman to prepare a Bill for the purpose. The Legal Draftsman has informed that the policy approval of the present Cabinet is required to continue the drafting of the said Bill. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Hon. President, in his capacity as the Minister of Finance, Planning and Economic Development, to grant policy approval of the Cabinet for the expeditious preparation of the said Bill, was approved by the Cabinet.
